chart.title: Red List Index
chart.subtitle: The [Red List Index](#dod:red_list_index) shows trends in overall [extinction risk](#dod:extinction_risk) for groups of species. It is an index between 0 and 1. A value of 1 indicates that there is no current extinction risk to any of the included species. A value of 0 would mean that all included species are extinct.
chart.note: Extinction risk estimates for mammals, birds, cycads, amphibians and corals are used to calculate the Red List Index. National and regional Red List Indices are calculated by weighting by the fraction of each species' distribution occurring within them.
